availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p: It is ordered by the Court that J. E. Vickrey be recommended to his excellency the Governor of Kentucky for to fill the office of coroner of Wayne County there being no election held for coroner in said county at the August Election in consiquence of there being no candidate for the office.
I John L. Sallie clerk of the Wayne County Court do certify the above to be a true transcript from the record in any office Witness Jno L Sallie clk of the county court afsd
Please forward the commission at your earliest convenience as we have no Sheriff and the coronor is the only chance we have to do business

Resfully Jno L Sallie
Wayne Co.
Corrpt Cor
Recd. 12th Sept/63
